1.name: Zucchini Gratin
1.summary:
This recipe serves 4 and takes around 30 min to make.
One portion of this dish costs about:

11.name: Breakfast Muffins
11.summary:
This recipe serves 1 week of breakfast for 1 person and takes around 30 min to make.
One portion of this dish costs about:

steps.description: In a mixing bowl, beat the eggs and add the oil and milk.
In another container, add the chestnut flour, brown sugar, and baking powder.
Combine the two mixtures and mix well until smooth and creamy.
Roughly chop the chocolate and the nut mix (a few cranberries and lupin seeds will also be delicious!).
Fold into the batter and let rest in the refrigerator for one hour.
Pour the batter into buttered muffin molds.
Bake at 180°C (356°F) for 17 minutes (insert a knife—if it comes out clean, the muffins are done!).

12.name: Telebreizh Crêpes (Original)
12.summary:
This recipe makes 40 crêpes and takes around 2 hours to prepare.
One portion of this dish costs about:

steps.description: In a mixing bowl, beat the eggs with the milk and butter.
Gradually incorporate the flour and water alternately to avoid lumps.
Cook each crêpe until almost golden — "a cooked crêpe is an overcooked crêpe."

13.name: Telebreizh Crêpes (Sweet Edition)
13.summary:
This recipe makes 40 crêpes and takes around 2 hours to prepare.
One portion of this dish costs about:

steps.description: In a mixing bowl, beat the eggs with the butter and part of the milk.
Gradually incorporate the flour and milk alternately to avoid lumps.
Add sugar to taste.
Cook each crêpe until almost golden — "a cooked crêpe is an overcooked crêpe."

14.name: Micheline’s Brioche (26th Gathering)
14.summary:
This recipe makes 1 brioche and takes around 2 hours to prepare.
One portion of this dish costs about:

steps.description: Mix the flour, baking powder, sugar, and salt.
Add the eggs, then the softened butter.
Add lukewarm milk and knead until you get a soft, non-sticky dough (about 5 minutes using a mixer).
Form into a ball, place in a bowl, and cover with a cloth.
Let rise for about 1 to 1½ hours in a warm place.
Punch down the dough by pressing in the center.
Knead again (optionally add raisins, chocolate chips, or candied fruit).
Shape as desired: braided brioche, rolls, or loaf-style brioche.
Let rise again in a warm, draft-free place until doubled in size.
Bake braided brioche for 20 min at 180°C (356°F); loaf brioche for 30–35 min; rolls for 15 min.
